definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: A similar question remains for the inheritance of the epigenetic characteristics from parents to offspring.
sentences.chinese: 表觀遺傳特性的同樣問題存在於親代和子代之間。

sentences.english: Differences between parental instars are the main reason for variation in parental factors.
sentences.chinese: 在親代自身因素的影響中，親代蟲齡差異是主要因素。

sentences.english: Differences between parental instars are the main reason for variation in parental factors.
sentences.chinese: 在親代自身因素的影響中，親代蟲齡差異是主要因素。

sentences.english: Which suggests that some algae may be handed down directly from parent to child.
sentences.chinese: 這表明一些藻類也許直接通過親代直接傳到子代。

sentences.english: This “parental investment theory” should apply especially well to humans.
sentences.chinese: 這種“親代投入理論”尤其可以很好地解釋人類行爲。

sentences.english: A few theories have focused on recombination - the process that occurs in sexual selection when the genetic sequences of parents are recombined.
sentences.chinese: 一些理論關注在性別選擇中親代基因序列重組過程。
